docs.title: Welcome to My Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the documentation site! This is your homepage.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Get started by exploring the documentation:

  • Getting Started - Learn the basics
  • About - More information about this project

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Easy to Use: Simple and intuitive documentation structure
  • Beautiful Design: Modern Material theme with dark mode support
  • Search: Full-text search functionality
  • Code Highlighting: Syntax highlighting for code blocks

docs.title: Example Code Block
docs.text:
def hello_world():
    print("Hello, World!")
    return True

docs.title: Admonition Example
docs.text:
Note

This is a note admonition. You can use different types like tip, warning, danger, etc.

Pro Tip

Use mkdocs serve to preview your documentation locally!

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text: Continue to the Getting Started guide to learn more.

docs.title: About
docs.text: This documentation site is built with MkDocs using the Material for MkDocs theme.

docs.title: Technology Stack
docs.text:
• MkDocs: Static site generator for documentation
  • Material for MkDocs: Modern theme with lots of features
  • Python Markdown: Extended markdown support
  • GitHub Pages: Hosting platform

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text:
• Instant loading
  • Section expansion
  • Back to top button
  • Navigation tabs

docs.title: Search
docs.text:
• Full-text search
  • Search suggestions
  • Search highlighting

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
• Code copy button
  • Syntax highlighting
  • Admonitions (notes, tips, warnings)
  • Emoji support
  • Tables
  • Tabs

docs.title: Customization
docs.text:
You can customize the site by editing mkdocs.yml:

  • Change the theme colors
  • Add or remove features
  • Modify navigation structure
  • Add custom CSS or JavaScript
  • Configure plugins

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
• MkDocs Documentation
  • Material for MkDocs Documentation
  • Markdown Guide

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
To contribute to this documentation:

  1. Clone the repository
  2. Make your changes
  3. Test locally with mkdocs serve
  4. Submit a pull request

docs.title: License
docs.text: See the LICENSE file for details.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide will help you get started with the documentation.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
To work with this documentation locally, you'll need to install MkDocs and its dependencies:

pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: Running Locally
docs.text:
To preview the documentation locally:

mkdocs serve

This will start a development server at http://127.0.0.1:8000/.

docs.title: Building the Site
docs.text:
To build the static site:

mkdocs build

The built site will be in the site/ directory.

docs.title: Deployment
docs.text:
To deploy to GitHub Pages:

mkdocs gh-deploy

This will build the site and push it to the gh-pages branch.

docs.title: Adding New Pages
docs.text:
1. Create a new Markdown file in the docs/ directory
  2. Add it to the navigation in mkdocs.yml:
nav:
  - Home: index.md
  - Your New Page: your-page.md

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Use # for headers. The number of # symbols indicates the header level.

docs.title: Lists
docs.text:
• Bullet point 1
  • Bullet point 2

  • Nested item

  • Numbered item 1

  • Numbered item 2

docs.title: Code Blocks
docs.text:
Use triple backticks with a language identifier:

def example():
    return "Hello"

docs.title: Links
docs.text: Link text

docs.title: Tips
docs.text:
Tip

Save your files and the preview will auto-reload!

Warning

Don't commit the site/ directory to git - it's built automatically.
